result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kayla Ann Neumann

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 2:48 PM/ RM 301, 22CF197 & 22CF199. Defendant Kayla Ann Neumann appeared by video, in custody in Langlade County Jail.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court reviews case history. State notes no report from PD Office. Def. states she has applied for a PD and is waiting for counsel. Def. requests to be heard on bond. Court denies, as needs to be heard by Judge Rhode.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

1:15 PM Defendant Kayla Ann Neumann in court, in custody from Langlade County Jail, via zoom.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin Kelly Hays in court, via zoom. 22CF199 Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed atty. or represent self. CC now calls 22CF197 return on warrant - Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 4 options, PD, hire own, court appointed atty. or represent self. Victim is present in courtroom.  State gives bail/bond recommendation $10,000 cash bond to cover both files with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their residence. Court recalls at 1:16 pm. because Clerk notes not on DAR. CC goes over complaint and rights with def. again. State gives same bail/bond recommendation. Victim makes statement. Def. makes statement regarding bail/bond. Court orders $10,000 cash bond with conditions Maintain Absolute Sobriety. No illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no contact with victim 1 or victim 2 or their residence. Def. will represent herself.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Judge Rhode declined as no name on warrant
